intro: Senecio ionodasys, commonly known as the mountain groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small yellow flowers in clusters. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
